column4: hello, I have here an IBM intellistation M pro, with a sound card Intel 81802 ICH4. I run Ubuntu Feisty, my install is exactly 3 minutes old. I just did a fresh install because I've spent a bloody day on this particular slight problem: there is no bloody sound at all! Neither at start up, nor during use nor during log out. No bad sound, just no sound. I know there is a solution very simple to get it to work because I already came to
your rely is cut off.  Pastebin the output from ``amixer'', then tell me the URL.
been trying to send you the output of amixer, but gaim crashes
try this command /exactly/ in a Terminal:  amixer set 'External Amplifier' mute
Now, how can I make sure that when I'll reboot, it'll still be ok?
